devdoc.details: Locks an ERC20 on the source chain and sends LZ message to the remote chain to mint a wrapped token

bridge(address,uint256,address,(address,.details: Locks an ERC20 on the source chain and sends LZ message to the remote chain to mint a wrapped token

bridgeNative(uint256,address,(address,ad.details: Locks WETH on the source chain and sends LZ message to the remote chain to mint a wrapped token

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

params.sharedDecimals: number of decimals used for all original tokens mapped to the same wrapped token. E.g., 6 is shared decimals for USDC on Ethereum, BSC and Polygon

renounceOwnership().details: Overrides the renounce ownership logic inherited from openZeppelin `Ownable`

setUseCustomAdapterParams(bool).details: Can be called only by the bridge owner

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

LDtoSDConversionRate(address).notice: Token conversion rates from local decimals (LD) to shared decimals (SD). E.g., if local decimals is 18 and shared decimals is 6, the conversion rate is 10^12

PT_MINT().notice: A packet type used to identify messages requesting minting of wrapped tokens

PT_UNLOCK().notice: A packet type used to identify messages requesting unlocking of original tokens

bridge(address,uint256,address,(address,.notice: Bridges ERC20 to the remote chain

bridgeNative(uint256,address,(address,ad.notice: Bridges native gas token (e.g. ETH) to the remote chain

remoteChainId().notice: LayerZero id of the remote chain where wrapped tokens are minted

setUseCustomAdapterParams(bool).notice: Sets the `useCustomAdapterParams` flag indicating whether the contract uses custom adapter parameters or the default ones

supportedTokens(address).notice: Tokens that can be bridged to the remote chain

totalValueLockedSD(address).notice: Total value locked per each supported token in shared decimals

weth().notice: Address of the wrapped native gas token (e.g. WETH, WBNB, WMATIC)
